title: Finance Manager/Controller
description: We are seeking an experienced Finance Manager/Controller to oversee our financial operations and reporting. You will be responsible for managing accounting processes, financial analysis, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.
responsibilities: Oversee monthly financial close process and prepare financial statements
Manage budgeting and forecasting processes
Ensure compliance with GAAP and financial regulations
Lead financial analysis and reporting initiatives
Supervise accounting staff and coordinate with external auditors
Implement and maintain internal controls and procedures
requirements: CPA certification required
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance
5+ years of experience in financial management or public accounting
Strong knowledge of GAAP and financial regulations
Advanced Excel skills and experience with ERP systems
Excellent analytical and communication skills
niceToHave: MBA or advanced degree in Finance
Experience with financial software implementations
Public company reporting experience
Management consulting background
Six Sigma or process improvement certification
benefits: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance

title: FPGA Engineer
description: Join our hardware engineering team to design and develop cutting-edge FPGA solutions for next-generation products. You'll work on complex digital signal processing and hardware acceleration projects.
responsibilities: Design and implement FPGA-based solutions for signal processing
Develop HDL code (VHDL/Verilog) for complex digital systems
Collaborate with software teams on hardware-software integration
Perform timing analysis and optimize designs for performance
Create comprehensive documentation and test procedures
Support hardware validation and debugging activities
requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field
3+ years of FPGA development experience
Proficiency in VHDL/Verilog and FPGA development tools (Vivado, Quartus)
Experience with high-speed digital design and signal processing
Knowledge of embedded systems and communication protocols
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills
niceToHave: PhD in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
Experience with SystemVerilog and UVM
Knowledge of DSP algorithms and implementations
Familiarity with PCIe, DDR, and high-speed interfaces
Experience with FPGA acceleration for AI/ML workloads
benefits: Annual training budget for skill development

title: Front End Engineer
description: We're looking for a talented Front End Engineer to join our product development team. You'll be responsible for creating exceptional user experiences and implementing modern web applications using cutting-edge technologies.
responsibilities: Develop responsive web applications using React, Next.js, and TypeScript
Collaborate with designers to implement pixel-perfect UI/UX designs
Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
Participate in code reviews and contribute to team best practices
Work closely with backend engineers to integrate APIs
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
2+ years of experience with React and modern JavaScript
Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and responsive design
Experience with TypeScript and modern build tools
Knowledge of version control systems (Git)
Strong understanding of web performance optimization
niceToHave: Experience with Next.js and server-side rendering
Knowledge of GraphQL and state management libraries
Familiarity with design systems and component libraries
Understanding of web accessibility standards (WCAG)
Experience with testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress)

title: Principal Software Engineer - C++
description: Lead our high-performance systems development as a Principal Software Engineer specializing in C++. You'll architect and implement critical infrastructure components that power our platform at scale.
responsibilities: Lead the design and development of high-performance C++ applications
Mentor junior and senior engineers on best practices and architecture
Drive technical decision-making for complex system designs
Optimize code for performance, memory usage, and scalability
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on system integration
Establish coding standards and review processes
requirements: Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
8+ years of professional C++ development experience
Expert knowledge of modern C++ standards (C++17/20)
Experience with multithreading, concurrency, and parallel programming
Strong background in system design and architecture
Leadership experience and mentoring capabilities
niceToHave: Experience with real-time systems and high-frequency trading
Love measuring and reducing latency - and care about every nanosecond
Have worked on performance-sensitive systems in trading, gaming, networking, or OS-level dev
Are comfortable working in C, C++, or Rust
Have experience optimizing for CPU/memory/cache or real-time constraints
Understand networking protocols (TCP/UDP) and kernel internals
benefits: Flexible work arrangements and unlimited PTO
Conference attendance and continuing education support

title: Principal Software Engineer - Python
description: Drive innovation as a Principal Python Engineer, leading the development of scalable backend systems and data processing pipelines. You'll shape our technical direction while mentoring the next generation of engineers.
responsibilities: Architect and develop scalable Python applications and microservices
Lead technical initiatives and drive engineering excellence
Design and implement data processing pipelines and APIs
Mentor engineers and establish development best practices
Collaborate on system architecture and technology decisions
Optimize systems for performance and reliability
requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
8+ years of professional Python development experience
Expertise in Python frameworks (Django, FastAPI, Flask)
Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Knowledge of distributed systems and microservices architecture
Leadership and mentoring experience
niceToHave: Experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)
Knowledge of machine learning and data science libraries
Familiarity with event-driven architecture and message queues
Understanding of database optimization and caching strategies
Open source contribution experience

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description: Join our infrastructure team to build and maintain the systems that power our applications. You'll work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and automation tools to ensure scalability and reliability.
responsibilities: Design and implement CI/CD pipelines and automation workflows
Manage cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code
Monitor system performance and implement observability solutions
Collaborate with development teams on deployment strategies
Ensure security best practices across all infrastructure
Lead incident response and post-mortem processes
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
5+ years of DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering experience
Expertise in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Proficiency with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation)
Strong scripting skills in Python, Bash, or Go
niceToHave: Certified in major cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience with service mesh technologies (Istio, Linkerd)
Knowledge of chaos engineering and reliability testing
Familiarity with GitOps workflows and tools
Experience with security scanning and compliance automation
benefits: Full health, dental, and vision coverage

title: Data Scientist
location: United States, New York, New York
description: Join our data science team to extract insights from complex datasets and build predictive models that drive business decisions. You'll work with cutting-edge machine learning technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
responsibilities: Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable business insights
Collaborate with engineering teams to deploy models into production
Create data visualizations and reports for stakeholders
Conduct A/B tests and statistical analysis
Stay current with latest developments in data science and ML
requirements: Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, or related field
3+ years of experience in data science or machine learning
Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL
Experience with ML frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Strong statistical analysis and hypothesis testing skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
niceToHave: PhD in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Physics)
Experience with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop)
Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks
Familiarity with cloud ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, GCP AI Platform)
Experience in specific domains (finance, healthcare, e-commerce)

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Build and deploy machine learning systems at scale as a Machine Learning Engineer. You'll work on cutting-edge AI projects and help bring ML models from research to production.
responsibilities: Design and implement scalable ML pipelines and infrastructure
Deploy machine learning models into production environments
Optimize model performance and monitor system reliability
Collaborate with data scientists to productionize research models
Implement MLOps practices and automated testing frameworks
Research and evaluate new ML technologies and frameworks
requirements: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field
4+ years of experience in machine learning engineering
Strong programming skills in Python and/or Scala
Experience with cloud platforms and containerization
Knowledge of ML frameworks and model serving technologies
Understanding of distributed systems and data engineering
niceToHave: Experience with MLOps tools and model monitoring platforms
Knowledge of GPU programming and distributed training
Familiarity with streaming data processing frameworks
Understanding of model compression and optimization techniques
Experience with edge deployment and mobile ML
benefits: Flexible work arrangements and remote options

title: Product Manager - AI
description: Lead AI product strategy and development as a Product Manager specializing in artificial intelligence solutions. You'll drive product vision, work with engineering teams, and shape the future of our AI offerings.
responsibilities: Define and execute AI product strategy and roadmap
Collaborate with engineering, design, and data science teams
Conduct market research and competitive analysis
Gather and prioritize product requirements from stakeholders
Track product metrics and analyze user feedback
Present product updates to executive leadership
requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, or related field
5+ years of product management experience
Strong understanding of AI/ML technologies and applications
Experience with agile development methodologies
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong communication and leadership abilities
niceToHave: MBA or advanced degree in business or technology
Technical background in AI/ML or data science
Experience with B2B SaaS product management
Knowledge of AI ethics and responsible AI practices
International product management experience
